author: Staff Reporter
text:
With scores of paintings in various hues displayed at an exhibition here on Saturday, visitors had a glimpse into various painting styles. S. Anantha Chandra Bose, Chairman of V.O. Chidambaranar Port Trust inaugurated the exhibition in the presence of Deputy Chairman S. Natarajan. They took a glance at the paintings, showcasing beautiful natural scenery, human life, wildlife, flora and fauna. Vibrant paintings, representing a variety of styles, brightened the venue.

Sumeeta Pattanayak of Odisha, who organised the programme, told The Hindu that 85 paintings were on display. Referring to its types, she said acrylic, oil, charcoal, watercolour and pencil sketches were on show, though most of them were acrylic paintings. Above all the expo was aimed at conveying the message of peace and harmony as preached by Lord Buddha. Paintings of Lord Buddha found a prominent position at the expo. Ms. Pattanayak said Buddhism had a great impact on the history of Odisha. It was as a sign of peace, that Lord Buddha was found in paintings in meditation with his eyes closed. The painting of meditating Buddha was a soother for all. Few of the paintings of Shreyas Pattanayak, Ms. Pattanayak’s 11-year-old son, have also been displayed at the expo. He said he developed interest in painting very early.

Deputy Inspector General of Indian Coast Guard, Tuticorin Station Navdeep Raj, Captain S.R. Pattanayak, Harbour Master, V.O.C. Port, visited the expo.
title: Paintings spread message of peace and harmony
